intro: Malanea bahiensis, commonly known as the Bahia malanea, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, thriving in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
